messages.message:
Hey all - want to ask if any of you know how this could be done in Instabase:
Is there a way to *break away* in the middle of a flow to manually edit the intermediate data, then start the flow again to finish the rest of the steps/calculation?

_Use case_: In SwissRe's premium validation, they want to perform a lookup between the input data and an existing csv file. If some value in the input data is not in that csv table, they want to let the underwriter manually add an entry to the csv table. After that, a bunch of calculation will be done on using the input data + that csv table and some other static files.

Without that manual entry step, the whole validation can be implemented as a flow. With this manual step I'm not sure how to do it. I can hardcode this lookup-and-edit feature into the onboarding app, but I feel like it should be handled somewhere else (onboarding app is  mostly about data extraction and schema mapping)
my first thought is -- currently we would handle this as two flows

yes, using two flows would work (i'm thinking along that line too). the user would need to manually trigger the second flow though, which i think is fine for the poc. Or is there a way to automatically trigger the second flow?

One idea: if we can support letting a flow be triggered based on some data change in a file, we can sort of enable the second flow to run automatically after the user edits the intermediate data

@Ted Isn't this similar to the same request Capital One has around trying to encrypt/tokenize data mid-stream? Due to the fact you won't know its credit card/SSN number until you run a way to structure the data, but you don't want it intermediately saved anywhere.

No, the tokenization thing would be automatic. Kerry — I don’t have anything to add to the ideas you and Jess already have, but if you __do__ find something that works well here, this will be an amazing feature in general to have (Flow->Human->Flow as a general sequence). We don’t really have any building blocks right now that represent “human in the loop”.

Flow Review is a place to add “human at the end” processing…. perhaps this could somehow be worked into Flow Review such that the human changing / validating the output of Flow 1 is what automatically triggers Flow 2?
